Posted By: Dragek (7/30/2009 9:25:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: yeah. debating whether to use ajani or elspeth is always a tough decision. ajani's first ability is really pointless, except for building to his ultimate, which comes down alot faster than elspeth's. however, his second ability is amazing, the drawback being he cannot use this every turn, as he will die after 4 turns, most likely alot sooner because of attack. elspeth has one very useful ability (token), and one situational one (flying pump). however, both increase her loyalty so keep her alive longer, and her ultimate wins games... I guess in a soldier/creature based deck I will run 2 and 2.
posts.html:

I guess in a soldier/creature based deck I will run 2 and 2.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
having played against it but not with it my opinion is that it's first ability is annoying but shouldn't cause too much trouble other than slowing the game.   
his last ability is alright but not too game changing unless played early enough against.. actually not really that great as white doesn't have much to stop it getting chump blocked or killed pretty fast.  
and his second ability is insanely good and can be very devastating if he isn't killed quickly.

posts.post_content: The most crucial decks for Ajani are black/white tokens, green/white tokens, and mono-white weenie. His second ability has immense power with these kinds of cards. His first ability is also good as well since if he is ever damaged by spells it will mean extra life for you. Can't say that his last ability is all that great and considering the power his first two abilities its probably never going to need to be played.

Posted By: ederchan (7/31/2009 6:40:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: That avatar creature would be a beast with lifelink (or better yet, give him the Behemoth Sledge to give llifelink and trample). He'd get 2/2 stronger every turn from Ajani's first ability (or he'd gain a +1/+1 counter), and then he swings away to deal damage equal to your life (maybe higher, depending on what equipment and counters he has), and then nearly doubles his own P/T, and the fun begins again next turn.

posts.post_content: I have a deck built around this guy, specifically for my friends annoying sap deck. I use [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden) and [Congregate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Congregate) along with a few other cards that boost my hp. When were playing if the draw allows with the m\*\*\* amounts of lings spawning I reach 100+ hp extremely fast. Useing my counters to survive and a few uncommons until I get my avatar, I just continually feed him. When I get my avatar he is ends up being a nuclear bomb, coupled with goldmanes 2nd ability, and creatures i have out already, now recently "trample" in my deck aswell, its pure destruction. I don't see why no one likes his last ability, if you really want to utilize this guy it requires the proper combos and setup. I can see how having that avatar out would be frightening with control issues on the battlefield, but I also have [Pitfall Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pitfall Trap) if hes taken over, and Order/Chaos. And if ALL fails, [Insurrection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Insurrection) . So with good counters, lif... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Neutralion (12/30/2009 6:27:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Honestly, the ultimate is one of those either it works and you kill your opponent or you have it chump blocked by sage owls rest of the game or bitter blossom tokens, that is if it doesn't immediately get terminated or etc first. Only time I've had someone pull off the ultimate against me I used a slave of bolas on the avatar and smacked them with it. Sarkhans ability is arguably better since even though they are still creatures, you have multiples of them so unless they all get hit by a wrath of god they are less susceptible to removal. By far goldmane's best ability is his second one, that's just amazing for aggro decks. His first ability is closely mirrored by ajani vengeant and sorin markov, and the last ability has to many ways an opponent may counter it, some being especially brutal (mind control, sower of temptation, grab the reigns, and others).
  
   
Oh, and no you're not likely to get out a behemoth sledge and shield of the righteous together (though possible), especially si... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Donovan_Fabian (12/26/2009 9:08:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: He goes great with my Wall of Reverence. I regularly have more then 40 health (thanks to Ondu cleric) when the token comes to the field. And there are plenty of white cards that grant flying (I favor Asha's Favor, Serra's Embrace, and Armored Ascension. In that order) Most of the time I don't use the token to fight, I let it sit there with one of my Wall of Reverences and double my life every turn. Use this card in a lifegain deck. Ondu cleric works wonders with the other white allys by the way.

posts.post_content:
so what you do, once you pump out the avatar, lets say it is a 5/5 (5 life) pay 2, equip shield of the ritgeous, pay 3 more, equip behemoth sledge, now it is a 7/9 trample, lifelink, vigilant that keeps what ever it blocks tapped, block, and it is now a 14/16 and you are at 12, swing, play rafiq, swing with the 15/17 FS, damage, it is a 30/32 and you are at 27, normal combat, damage, 60/62 and you are at 57, it goes down to a 59/61 without the exalted boost on their turn, block again, 116 life and it is a 118/120, your turn, finest hour, by the time it is over, you are at 1900 and your token is at 1902/1904  
  
of course, that is \*\*\*uming your opponent survived the first strike when you were at 12 life, you know, the turn before ^\_^  
  
now, that is a little tricky to pull off, I will admit it, but it is doable, and ajani's last ability is great for a mono white fog+lifegain deck, I dont think Ajani is the best planeswalker, but he is up there, and great in an agro deck due to his second abi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
